sentence.Network_en: Margaret Thatcher's espousal of monetarism eventually brought inflation down in the early 1980s.
sentence.Network_cn: 玛格丽特·撒切尔对于货币主义的拥护最终使通货膨胀在20世纪八十年代降了下来。

sentence.Network_en: Friedman's counterattack against Keynes began with the doctrine known as monetarism.
sentence.Network_cn: 弗里德曼对凯恩斯反击以货币主义论开始.

sentence.Network_en: Monetarism, led by Milton Friedman , which holds that inflation is always and everywhere a monetary phenomenon.
sentence.Network_cn: 货币主义, 由米尔顿弗里德曼, 持有,通货膨胀始终是一种货币现象到处领导.

entry.def: Monetarism is an economic policy that involves controlling the amount of money that is available and in use in a country at any one time.

means.word_mean: 1. an economic theory holding that variations in unemployment and the rate of inflation are usually caused by changes in the supply of money

auth_sentence.content: The experiment in "monetarism" - using the control of the money supply to control inflation - was quite quickly abandoned.
auth_sentence.res_content: The experiment in "monetarism" - using the control of the money supply to control inflation - was quite quickly abandoned.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: The experiment in "monetarism" - using the control of the money supply to control inflation - was quite quickly abandoned.

auth_sentence.content: As a theory of hyperinflation, monetarism seemed to have been the most relevant macroeconomic framework.
